index.presentation: Unifycoin is the fastest network to send money through the globe.
index.p-first:
Unifycoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate with no central authority or banks.

All transactions are spread though the network and will get verified; the block creation is also lead by the consensus decentralized protocol.

Therefore, firstly, the system is maintained and secure, secondly, you can send some coins and synchronize the blockchain all around the world.
index.p-second:
We recommand to you to synchronize the blockchain to send and to get the great value of your balance.
Thereby, we have established a fast synchronization of the blockchain. There's an overview of the performance.
index.sync-second: Synced in 1 second with 1.5 Mb.s-ยน.
index.p-third: This coins have an extremely good encryption never seen before with 58<sup>27</sup> possibles publics keys. The best elliptic curve is also used for encrypt private key to public key.
index.p-fourth: Conversely to Proof of Work (PoW), wich requires huge amounts of energy, Proof of Stake (PoS) gives mining power based on the percentage of coins held by a miner.
index.p-fifth:
Obviously, the transaction's fee varies.

This resume to a simple formula and a calculation in Kb.

faq.ans1: Unifycoin is a decentralized Proof Of Stake (POS) cryptocurrency wich his best assets is speed and security.
faq.ans2: A cryptocurrency is a digital currency that is secured by cryptography, in contrast to conventional (fiat) currencies where they are secured by a government or cluster of governments.
faq.ans3: Unifycoin is not run by any individual company or person. All user is a part of the Unifycoin network.
faq.ans4: The Proof of Stake (PoS) concept states that a person can mine or validate block transactions according to how many coins they hold.
faq.loose: I lost my wallet/private key, what can I do?
faq.ans5: By prevention, it is advisable to recover your wallet/private key. If you lost your private key, we can do nothing. So, be aware to save it.
faq.backup: How do I back up my wallet?
faq.ans6: You need to back up the file "wallet.dat", you can find this in the data directory. On Windows, by default this is <samp>"%APPDATA%\Unifycoin\"</samp>.
